alert.note: Alert for Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 21 at 12:58PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT SOUTHWESTERN BONNER COUNTY... At 1157 AM PST, a snow squall was located near Coolin and Sandpoint. Movement was southwest at 10 mph. Winds in excess of 30 mph are possible with this squall. Locations impacted include... Sandpoint, Ponderay, Kootenai, Dover, Schweitzer Mountain, Cocolalla and Coolin. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 95 in Idaho between mile markers 460 and 480. U.S. Highway 2 in Idaho between mile markers 14 and 28. Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this snow squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are expected. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
